This method seems to be [deprecated in gazebo 8.0](https://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1event_1_1Events.html#a7377743aa9b027374ced09c8c6a58fad).

Another detail: we are calling the event method in the destructor but this->updateConnection is setup in the `init()` method and not in the constructor. In a run with only constructor + destructor, would this be safe? has it fully sense?
content.html:
This method seems to be deprecated in gazebo 8.0.

Another detail: we are calling the event method in the destructor but this->updateConnection is setup in the init() method and not in the constructor. In a run with only constructor + destructor, would this be safe? has it fully sense?

content.raw:
None of the 4 worlds are loading for me. `plane_demo`, `plane_propeller_demo` and `quad_rotor_demo` print errors and just hang in the terminal, gzclient doesn't even come up:

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
~~~

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/quad_rotor_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_2_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_3_joint
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_4_joint
Error [Element.cc:684] Missing element description for [control]
~~~

~~~
louisep@hadaly:~/gazebo_source/gazeboC/build$ gazebo --verbose ../worlds/plane_propeller_demo.world 
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:121] model: lift_drag_demo_model
[Err] [PlaneDemoPlugin.cc:132] rod_1_joint
~~~

And the iris world opens gzclient but the screen stays black...

Am I just not waiting long enough? I checked that I have the correct models from the gazebo_models PR.

content.raw:
Note that ArduCopter plugin blocks gzserver until connection is established with ardupilot, hence the black screen. Maybe it's better to not block the server but just forcefully pause simulation instead. 

There are some instructions on setting up ardupilot in `iris_standoff_demo.world`. Oh and maybe we can rename it to just `iris_demo.world`?
content.html:
Note that ArduCopter plugin blocks gzserver until connection is established with ardupilot, hence the black screen. Maybe it's better to not block the server but just forcefully pause simulation instead.

There are some instructions on setting up ardupilot in iris_standoff_demo.world. Oh and maybe we can rename it to just iris_demo.world?

content.raw:
I renamed it to iris_arducopter_demo.world

Looking into how to pause simulation.
content.html:
I renamed it to iris_arducopter_demo.world

Looking into how to pause simulation.

content.raw:
8510348

Added detection for whether ArduCopter is online or not. If ArduCopter is detected (receive of fdm packet from someone), then socket receive wait time is increased from 1ms to 1 sec to accomodate network instability. If ArduCopter is not detected, receive call blocks for 1ms on each call.
Once ArduCopter presence is detected, it takes 15 (configurable) missed receives before declaring the FCS offline.
content.html:
8510348

Added detection for whether ArduCopter is online or not. If ArduCopter is detected (receive of fdm packet from someone), then socket receive wait time is increased from 1ms to 1 sec to accomodate network instability. If ArduCopter is not detected, receive call blocks for 1ms on each call. Once ArduCopter presence is detected, it takes 15 (configurable) missed receives before declaring the FCS offline.
